ngiemboon: Akwɔ̀ʼɔ yɔɔn, gʉa ńkaa yendyɛ̀ʼɛ ńdɔg ńtó.
en: Here is the chair, go carry the other one to bring.
how many ...? (question for nouns from class 10)
How many chickens did you see?

ngiemboon: À ka kaa nzẅìŋe lʉŋ, ńtÿɔ́gɔ na yesẅé.
en: He carried an old chair to put on the new one.
that one (distant demonstrative pronoun that refers to class 7, 9 and 10 nouns)

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńtó, pi júu yéyɛ̌ ńná né mèŋ.
en: If you arrive, buy this one to give to me.

ngiemboon: Gʉa na mepɔ̀ɔn mɛ̂, ńnáa yezẅìŋ né mèŋ.
en: Among those bags, give me the old one.
those there (middle distant demonstrative pronoun that refers to class 7, 9 or 10 nouns)
that ... there (middle demonstrative adjective modifying class 7 and 9 nouns)
those ... there (middle demonstrative adjective modifying class 10 nouns)

ngiemboon: Ntúʼ yɔɔn, kaa yɛ̀ ńgʉa ńtÿɔ́gɔ ngʉ̀ŋe wó.
en: Here is a calabash, carry this one to put aside.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ gɔɔn ngie mèŋ n kaa yɛ̌ pɔ̀ɔn?
en: Which bag are you saying I'm carrying?
theirs (third person plural possessive pronoun referring back to class 9 nouns)
their (third person plural possessive adjective modifying class 9 nouns)
their (third person plural emphatic possessive adjective modifying class 9 nouns)

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie pɔ́ zẅíʼte wɔ́b yɔ́b.
en: They have to wait for them too.
theirs (third person plural possessive pronoun referring back to class 7 and 10 nouns)
their (third person plural possessive adjective modifying class 7 and 10 nouns)
their (third person plural emphatic possessive adjective modifying class 7 and 10 nouns)
yours and mine (first and second person singular pronoun referring back to class 7 and 10 nouns)
your and my (first and second person singular adjective modifying class 7 and 10 nouns)
your and my (first and second person emphatic singular adjective modifying class 7 and 10 nouns)
yours and mine (first and second person singular pronoun referring back to class 9 nouns)
your and my (first and second person singular adjective modifying class 9 nouns)
your and my (first and second person emphatic singular adjective modifying class 9 nouns)
this one here (close demonstrative pronoun modifying class 7 and 9 nouns)
these here (close demonstrative pronoun modifying class 10 nouns)
this ... here (close demonstrative adjective modifying class 7 and 9 nouns)
these ... here (close demonstrative adjective modifying class 10 nouns)

ngiemboon: Gʉa na mekwɔ̀ʼɔ mɔɔn, ńkaa yɔɔn.
en: Among these stools, carries this one.
mine (first person singular possessive pronoun referring back to class 7 and 10 nouns)
my (first person singular possessive adjective modifying class 7 and 10 nouns)
my (first person singular emphatic possessive adjective modifying class 7 and 10 nouns)

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ nyě pɔ̀ɔn jú, ńkaa yɔ́ɔn.
en: You left your bag to carry mine.
